MODF(3) Library Functions Manual MODF(3)

NAME

modf — return integral and fractional parts

SYNOPSIS

#include <math.h>

double
modf(double value, double *iptr);

long double
modfl(long double value, long double *iptr);

float
modff(float value, float *iptr);

DESCRIPTION

The modf() break value into integral and fractional parts, each of which has the same sign as the argument. They return the fractional part, and store the integral part (as a floating-point number) in the object pointed to by iptr

SPECIAL VALUES

modf(±infinity, iptr) returns ±0 and stores ±infinity in the object pointed to by iptr.

modf(NaN, iptr) returns a NaN and stores a NaN in the object pointed to by iptr.

SEE ALSO

frexp(3), ldexp(3), math(3)

STANDARDS

The modf() functions conform to ISO/IEC 9899:2011.

December 11, 2006 Mac OS X 12
